items.abstract: <jats:p>The notions of<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mml:mi>L</mml:mi></mml:math>-sobriety and<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mml:mi>L</mml:mi></mml:math>-spatiality are introduced for the category<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mml:mi>L</mml:mi></mml:math>-BiTop of<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mml:mi>L</mml:mi></mml:math>-bitopological spaces. Such notions are used to extend the known adjunction between the category<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mml:mi>L</mml:mi></mml:math>-Top of<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mml:mi>L</mml:mi></mml:math>-topological spaces and the category Loc of locals to one between the category<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mml:mi>L</mml:mi></mml:math>-BiTop and BiLoc. Also, the concepts of localic regularity and localic compactness are introduced in the mentioned category.</jats:p>
title: Sobriety and Localic Compactness in Categories ofL-Bitopological Spaces

items.abstract: <jats:p>Ahsanullah (1988) showed the compatibility between group structures and<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="$I$"><mml:mi>I</mml:mi></mml:math>-fuzzy neighborhood systems. In this paper, we require not only that the<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="$I$"><mml:mi>I</mml:mi></mml:math>-fuzzy neighborhood systems be compatible with the group structures, but also compatible with the order relation, in one sense or another.</jats:p>
title: Fuzzy neighborhood structures on partially ordered groups

items.abstract: <jats:p>The photophysical properties of samarium ion in presence of 7-Acetoxy Coumarin 3-Carboxylic acid (ACC) or 1-(4-methoxyphenyl) 3-(4-t-butyl phenyl) 1,3-propandione (MBPK), which act as antenna of near-UV radiation, are studied in different homogeneous, and heterogeneous media as well as in rigid polymethylmethacrylate matrix (PMMA). High quantum yield value of the sensitized emission of (<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="${\text{Sm}}^{{\text{3 + }}} $" id="E1"><mml:mrow><mml:msup><mml:mrow><mml:mtext>Sm</mml:mtext></mml:mrow><mml:mrow><mml:mtext>3+</mml:mtext></mml:mrow></mml:msup></mml:mrow></mml:math>-(ACC)) and (<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="${\text{Sm}}^{{\text{3 + }}} $" id="E2"><mml:mrow><mml:msup><mml:mrow><mml:mtext>Sm</mml:mtext></mml:mrow><mml:mrow><mml:mtext>3+</mml:mtext></mml:mrow></mml:msup></mml:mrow></mml:math>-(MBPK)) in N,N-dimethylformamide and PMMA matrix are obtained pointing to an efficient ligandto- metal energy transfer. Moreover, luminescence mappings for pattern recognition analysis that could be profitably exploited as a useful identification method in clinical chemistry and biochemistry have been obtained from which the nature of the solvent and/or the ligand is clearly identified by inspection of the corresponding excitation/emission matrix maps.</jats:p>
title: Factors affecting light energy transfer in some samarium complexes
